urls.title: LIWAC 2021 – Lagos International Water Conference 2021
urls.description: The domestic and industrial use of water and its importance to a state, especially an urbanized one, cannot b e over emphasized. This also means its scarcity, contamination or wastage will obviously be hazardous. Hence the Lagos State government, under the Lagos State Water Regulatory Commission (LASWARCO) is organizing its second Lagos International Water Conference LIWAC 2021. In line with its ministerial responsibility, it seeks to explore the primary objective of promoting the long term interest of

text: @IWAHQ @water4point0 @UCBerkeley @EmmaHowardBoyd @EnvAgency Nice array of speakers indeed! Follow us @Iiwaclagos to find out about our confirmed speakers for the #Lagos international Water Conference 2021. Register now at https://t.co/W249haO3la for details. Don’t miss it. https://t.co/A5aaLii0Sw

@Beeron1030 @PJennings88 @EnvAgency The obligation is to provide evidence that the aquifer isn't under threat, not the other way around. If everything is fine why doesn't HS2 and the EA share their evidence and why has Affinity Water been granted a multimillion indemnity to protect its revenues in case of damage?

@DouglasPilot @Greenstreet @CRTNorthWest @stormwater_jo @GroundworkCLM @River_Douglas_ @Mike_Forty @Bithells @WiganCouncil @Wingate_Wood @EnvAgencyNW @WigToday @VitaminSNC Great work. urls.title: Is the Environment Agency doing its job?
urls.description: Guy Linley-Adams, Solicitor to Salmon & Trout Conservation, shares the findings from their new report on the role of the Environment Agency & why greater investment is needed to make our rivers, lakes, and streams healthy by 2027.
